newsitem.title: USA: Wash. 1,158 MW nuke unit outage delayed to Mar 24.
newsitem.headline: Wash. 1,158 MW nuke unit outage delayed to Mar 24.

text.p: The expected outage of the 1,158 megawatt (MW) WNP-2 nuclear unit in Washington state will be delayed until at least March 24, a spokesman for the plant said Wednesday.
The unit was tentatively scheduled to shut down for "economic dispatch" next week, but the Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) requested the postponement, he said.
The plant has been operating at 100 percent capacity since Friday, due in part to temporary flow cutbacks at some Northwest hydropower projects.
BPA markets power produced at federal hydropower projects in the Northwest as well as power from the nuclear plant.
The nuclear unit will begin a regular refueling outage April 18, but is expected to be idled ahead of that date due to the availability of lower-cost hydropower once the spring runoff begins.
